Description: Painted pink limestone statuette of man wearing pointed (Cypriot) hood, chiton and himation with a red border. The smooth chiton widens to a cone shape at the bottom. The himation has a border which runs from approximately the right knee to the left shoulder. His right arm was across his chest, the left arm by his side. Long hair at back painted black. Flat back. Traces of black and red paint. The rear is flat, and not carefully rendered. Very worn and stained brown.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.004) (Phase 3)
